pageDescription: The Nissan Heisman House Tour makes its first of ten stops this season in Eugene, and is inviting fans to "get to know the Heisman's" with a pregame experience unlike any other. In a matchup being touted as the top non-conference game of the year, both teams are ranked in the top ten and are looking to make a statement early in the season. Fans can catch the Heisman House talent on the ESPN College GameDay Radio set, have the opportunity to win prizes by competing in fun interactive games, receive autographs from past Oregon players, and join ESPNs Neil Everett as he breaks down the game with former Duck greats.
pageKeywords: Nissan Heisman House Tour, Eugene, OR, ESPN College GameDay, Neil Everett, Oregon Football, Michigan State Football
recap: The sun shone bright on the Willamette Valley, as the Nissan Heisman House Tour kicked-off another year of bringing the Heisman Trophy to the season’s best matchups. It doesn’t get any better than the highly anticipated, non-conference battle between the Michigan State Spartans and the Oregon Ducks. Fans were able to beat the heat and get ready for the game by listening to ESPN personality, Neil Everett, relive some of Oregon’s greatest football moments with Duck greats Kenny Wheaton, who talked about “The Pick,” and Dennis Dixon, who waxed poetic on his memorable and exciting college career. After fans received autographs from Wheaton and Dixon, they were able to channel their inner Heisman and see if they had what it took to compete in the virtual “Quarterback Challenge.” It didn’t matter if you finished first or third on the depth chart, everyone could act like a Heisman Trophy winner by getting their picture taken with the award and win a myriad of prizes, including the sought after foam Oregon helmets. The road to the first ever College Football Playoff is a long one, but the Nissan Heisman House will be there for every mile of the journey. Join the Tour on September 20, when all the action is brought to the fans live from Lincoln, Nebraska.
site: The Nissan Heisman House will be located north of Autzen Stadium, on Martin Luther King Jr. Blvd. and ESPN College GameDay Radio will be located south of the stadium, on Leo Harris Parkway.
summary: The Nissan Heisman House Tour makes its first of ten stops this season in Eugene, and is inviting fans to "get to know the Heisman Winners" with a pregame experience unlike any other. In a matchup being touted as the top non-conference game of the year, both teams are ranked in the top ten and are looking to make a statement early in the season. Fans can catch the Heisman House talent on the ESPN College GameDay Radio set, have the opportunity to win prizes by competing in fun interactive games, receive autographs from past Oregon players, and join ESPNs Neil Everett as he breaks down the game with former Duck greats.
title: Michigan State @ Oregon

pageDescription: The Tour continues with another high-profile, non-conference game, as it rolls into Lincoln for a game between two historic powerhouses and old bowl game foes. The last time these teams met the Hurricanes stormed past the Huskers, and 2001 Heisman Trophy winner, Eric Crouch, on their way to a BCS National Championship. While the football landscape has changed, the bad blood between these two teams is hotter than ever. The Nissan Heisman House will once again be joined on-site by ESPN College GameDay Radio, and will provide fans with all the pregame action and appearances from former Husker stars.
pageKeywords: Nissan Heisman House Tour, Lincoln, NE, ESPN College GameDay, Neil Everett, Miami Football, Nebraska Football
recap: Very few schools have the privilege of having a Heisman Trophy winner, even fewer can boast that they have two, but when the Nissan Heisman House comes to town, the Nebraska Cornhusker’s three Heisman Trophy winners come out to celebrate. This past weekend in Lincoln was an unprecedented occasion for the Tour, with Heisman Trophy winners, Johnny Rodgers, Mike Rozier and Eric Crouch all in attendance to meet with fans and chat with ESPN personality, Neil Everett. The players spoke about their playing days at Nebraska and what it means to be a Heisman winner. This one-of-a-kind day let Husker fans get a unique perspective of what different eras of Nebraska football were like. Fans also had a chance to get their photo with the Heisman Trophy and strike a pose on the life-size podium. This was all the fans needed to get amped for a game against their old rival, the Miami Hurricanes. The game saw current Heisman candidate, Ameer Abdullah, not only run over the Hurricane defense, but had him running into the Nebraska record book as he broke Rodgers’ record for most all-purpose yards. This season is starting to pick up and so is the Nissan Heisman House. Join the Tour in Los Angeles, on September 27, as the USC Trojans take on the Oregon State Beavers.
site: The Nissan Heisman House will be open from Noon - 7:00pm CT and located inside Pinnacle Bank Arena. ESPN College GameDay Radio will be located outside the main entrance of the arena, on R Street.
summary: The Tour continues with another high-profile, non-conference game, as it rolls into Lincoln for a game between two historic powerhouses and old bowl game foes. The last time these teams met the Hurricanes stormed past the Huskers, and 2001 Heisman Trophy winner, Eric Crouch, on their way to a BCS National Championship. While the football landscape has changed, the bad blood between these two teams is hotter than ever. The Nissan Heisman House will once again be joined on-site by ESPN College GameDay Radio, and will provide fans with all the pregame action and appearances from former Husker stars.
title: Miami @ Nebraska

pageDescription: The Nissan Heisman House rolls into the third stop with an interesting matchup between the Beavers and the Trojans. USC comes into this season with good depth and a new attitude after a surprisingly good finish to last season. First year head coach, Steve Sarkisian, looks to build on that momentum against an Oregon State team that traditionally struggles in the Coliseum, but is no stranger to beating the Trojans over past years. Along with a great matchup comes great talent with former Heisman Trophy winners stopping by the House to talk with Neil Everett, meet fans, and sign autographs.
pageKeywords: Nissan Heisman House Tour, Los Angeles, CA, ESPN College GameDay, Neil Everett, Oregon State Football, USC Football
recap: The Nissan Heisman House Tour was onsite to equip fans for battle, as the USC Trojans came into this weekend’s home matchup against the Oregon State Beavers looking to get back on the winning track and stay undefeated in a tough Pac-12 conference. Fans were treated to chalk talks with 1981 Heisman Trophy winner, Marcus Allen, and 2004 All-American, Shaun Cody. The former greats spoke with ESPN personality, Neil Everett, about their successful careers playing at both USC and in NFL. Afterwards, fans had the chance to get autographs and snap a photo with the players. In between the talks, Trojan fans checked out the Nissan Pathfinder and could “catch a ride” with their favorite Heisman Trophy winner in the vehicles photo booth. On the field, the Trojans didn’t disappoint, as their stout defense stifled the Oregon State offense, and gave fans plenty of reasons to throw up the “V” for victory. The Heisman House takes a pit stop next week, but will be cleaned up and ready to go at the Rose Bowl for the Pac-12 matchup of the year between the Oregon Ducks and UCLA Bruins.
site: The Nissan Heisman House will be open from 2:00pm - 7:30pm PT and will be in the State Farm Fan Fest, outside the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum.
summary: The Nissan Heisman House rolls into the third stop with an interesting matchup between the Beavers and the Trojans. USC comes into this season with good depth and a new attitude after a surprisingly good finish to last season. First year head coach, Steve Sarkisian, looks to build on that momentum against an Oregon State team that traditionally struggles in the Coliseum, but is no stranger to beating the Trojans over past years. Along with a great matchup comes great talent with former Heisman Trophy winners stopping by the House to talk with Neil Everett, meet fans, and sign autographs.
title: Oregon State @ USC

pageDescription: It will be pandemonium in Pasadena, as two Heisman hopefuls square off at quarterback, in what could be an early season preview of the Pac-12 Championship. Brett Hundley and the Bruins look to defend their turf against a strong Duck’s backfield and an even stronger offense, led by Marcus Mariota. The Nissan Heisman House will have all the action where fans can compete in a QB Challenge, solve puzzles, and snap a photo with their favorite Heisman winner.
pageKeywords: Nissan Heisman House Tour, Pasadena, CA, ESPN College GameDay, Neil Everett, Oregon Football, UCLA Football
recap: A beautiful, sunny day at the Rose Bowl saw the Oregon Ducks and UCLA Bruins looking to get back on the winning track and keep hopes of a College Football Playoff berth alive. The Nissan Heisman House was in the UCLA Fan Zone to get fans ready for the heated match-up. Heisman talk has surrounded both teams. Ducks quarterback, Marcus Mariota, has been at the top of the Heisman Trophy watch list all season and the Bruins, Brett Hundley, has had favorable mention. Fans came out to the Heisman House to cast their votes for favorite Heisman Trophy candidates and then hopped into a Nissan Pathfinder to get a photo with a past Heisman winner. Also prepping for the big game at the House was a man with quite the presence, Pro Football Hall of Fame member, Jonathan Ogden. The former UCLA great chatted with ESPN’s, Neil Everett, about his college days and time spent in the NFL. Everett even brought up Ogden’s wresting past. Fans left the Heisman House donning foam helmets and were ready to beat the heat as well as the Ducks, but alas, it wasn’t meant to be. Mariota and the stout Oregon defense put a beat down on the Bruins, and reestablished their dominance in the Pac-12. Sadly, the Heisman House must leave the sunny shores of California, but will head for the Southern charm of the SEC. Fans can join the fun on November 11, as the Aubrun Tigers play host to the Aggies of Texas A&M.
site: The Heisman House will be included in the Fan Zone Presented by Ralph's, located in Lot H, just outside of Gates A & B along Rosemont Ave. and Arroyo Blvd.
summary: It will be pandemonium in Pasadena, as two Heisman hopefuls square off at quarterback, in what could be an early season preview of the Pac-12 Championship. Brett Hundley and the Bruins look to defend their turf against a strong Duck’s backfield and an even stronger offense, led by Marcus Mariota. The Nissan Heisman House will have all the action where fans can compete in a QB Challenge, solve puzzles, and snap a photo with their favorite Heisman winner.
title: Oregon @ UCLA

pageDescription: The Nissan Heisman House makes a return trip to Auburn, as the Tigers play host to the Aggies. A&M faces a difficult task against a top five Auburn team, with a top rushing attack. After the departure of 2012 Heisman Trophy winner, Johnny Manziel, to the NFL and a defense that was less than average in 2013, Texas A&M hopes to find some of that luck Auburn had last year, as they try to steal this game on the road. Neil Everett will be live in the Nissan Heisman House breaking down the game for all the fans in attendance.
pageKeywords: Nissan Heisman House Tour, Auburn, AL, ESPN College GameDay, Neil Everett, Texas A&M Football, Auburn Football
recap: After a brief break, the Nissan Heisman House made its fifth stop of the season in SEC country. Alabama’s “Loveliest Village on the Plains,” played the perfect host. When it comes to the SEC, every weekend can mean big changes in the College Football Playoff ranking. With Auburn holding the number three spot, the game against Texas A&M would prove to be no different. The Tiger faithful came in droves to the House looking to get an Auburn foam helmet or a coveted Nissan Heisman House Tour t-shirt. Fans were also able to vote for their favorite Heisman Trophy candidate. There is no doubt that many were voting for home team QB, Nick Marshall, in the hopes the school can add to its already stellar Heisman Trophy collection. In between getting photos taken with the Heisman Trophy and testing QB skills, those in attendance were treated to “Chalk Talks” and autographs with Auburn greats Taeko Spikes and Jason Campbell, hosted by ESPNs own Neil Everett. In a nod to Toomer’s Corner, Spikes took the “TP Challenge” from Everett to see if he could best the SportsCenter anchor by unraveling a roll of TP the quickest. Tiger’s fans had a great time in the House, but the same could not be said about the outcome on the field. The underdog Aggies likely put an end to the Tiger’s shot of playing in the College Football Playoff, but such tragedy is life in the always tough SEC conference. Be sure to join the Tour next week as it heads deeper into SEC territory to Gainesville, where the Florida Gators take on the South Carolina Gamecocks.
site: The Heisman House will be included in the Tiger Fan Fest, in front of the Nichols Center at the corner War Eagle Way and S. Donahue Dr.
summary: The Nissan Heisman House makes a return trip to Auburn, as the Tigers play host to the Aggies. A&M faces a difficult task against a top five Auburn team, with a top rushing attack. After the departure of 2012 Heisman Trophy winner, Johnny Manziel, to the NFL and a defense that was less than average in 2013, Texas A&M hopes to find some of that luck Auburn had last year, as they try to steal this game on the road. Neil Everett will be live in the Nissan Heisman House breaking down the game for all the fans in attendance.
title: Texas A&M @ Auburn

pageDescription: This week the Tour makes a stop in the swap, where the Gators look to drastically improve on a dismal 2013 season that saw them lose their last seven games, including a close one to a stout Gamecock’s team. Florida fans will no doubt be loud, as former Florida player and coach, Steve Spurrier, brings in a strong South Carolina team eyeing a trip to the SEC Championship game. Fans can come and interact with several games at the Heisman House for the chance to win various prizes, receive autographs from former Heisman greats, and relive past series matchups with Neil Everett.
pageKeywords: Nissan Heisman House Tour, Gainesville, FL, ESPN College GameDay, Neil Everett, South Carolina Football, Florida Football
recap: In the words of local music legend, Tom Petty, “waiting is the hardest part…” but the Nissan Heisman House Tour finally made its inaugural stop in Gator Country, better known as Gainesville, FL. On an unseasonably cold morning in The Swamp, a congregation of Gator fans descended on the Heisman House to meet Danny Wuerffel, one of the schools three Heisman Trophy winners. The two-time All-American spoke with ESPN personality, Neil Everett about what is means to have an on-campus statue erected in his honor, as well as the return of former Gator head coach, Steve Spurrier, to Ben Hill Griffin Stadium. After teaching Everett the proper way to Gator Chomp, Wuerffel posed for photos with fans and signed autographs. The Gators haven’t had great success on the field this season, but with the sun starting to shine, the home team’s side was full of hope as they took the field against the “Ol’ Ball Coach,” and his South Carolina Gamecocks squad. Alas, it wasn’t meant to happen for the Gators, as they dropped a heartbreaker in overtime. The Nissan Heisman House Tour bids a farewell to the SEC for the season, but moves right along to the state of Texas and the Big 12. The House makes another debut, this time in Waco, as the Baylor Bears play host to the Oklahoma State Cowboys.
site: The Heisman House will be located at the Reitz Union North Lawn, southeast of Ben Hill Griffin Stadium.
summary: This week the Tour makes a stop in the swamp, where the Gators look to drastically improve on a dismal 2013 season that saw them lose their last seven games, including a close one to a stout Gamecock’s team. Florida fans will no doubt be loud, as former Florida player and coach, Steve Spurrier, brings in a strong South Carolina team eyeing a trip to the SEC Championship game. Fans can come and interact with several games at the Heisman House for the chance to win various prizes, receive autographs from former Heisman greats, and relive past series matchups with Neil Everett.
title: South Carolina @ Florida

pageDescription: The seventh stop on the Tour has the Nissan Heisman House helping Baylor fans break in the new McLane Stadium. The Bears will be hunting for Cowboys, as they seek revenge against an Oklahoma State team that in 2013 dominated the then number four ranked Bears and almost cost them a Big 12 Championship and BCS Bowl berth. Bryce Petty will also be looking to build on a great resume that saw him finish seventh in last year’s Heisman voting. Fans can have to opportunity to win prizes, get autographs from past players, and break down game footage with our host before the Bears take on the Cowboys.
pageKeywords: Nissan Heisman House Tour, Waco, TX, ESPN College GameDay, Neil Everett, Oklahoma Football, Baylor Football
recap: Standing strong at number seven, the Baylor Bears were looking for a big win against a downtrodden Oklahoma State squad, in the hopes being ranked in the top four, launching them to the first ever College Football Playoff. The Nissan Heisman House had a first of its own this weekend, with its inaugural trip to Waco, TX. There was enough rain in Texas to sink the Brazos Belle, but that didn’t keep Bear’s fans from enjoying the Heisman House and all it had to offer. Fans were able to relive the recent successes of former Heisman Trophy winner, Robert Griffin III by posing with the trophy and taking a photo with the man himself inside the Nissan Rogue. ESPN Radio personality, Ryen Russillo took over host duties for the weekend and conducted chalk talks with Baylor legends, Grant Teaff and Mike Singletary. Teaff shed light on what it was like to coach a two-time All-American in Singletary, as well as on the current state of Baylor football.  NLF Hall of Famer, Singletary let fans in on his recruiting trip to Baylor and his experience of playing on the NFLs most legendary defense. The rain never subsided, but fans had all they needed to get ready for the game. Outfitted in the always-in-style foam helmet and Nissan Heisman House t-shirt, fans cheered the home team on to victory. The finish is near, but we aren’t there just yet. The Nissan Heisman House closes out its regular season tour this weekend with a good ole fashioned rivalry. We go to Tallahassee where the Florida State Seminoles look to continue their undefeated streak against the Florida Gators.
site: The Heisman House will be included in Touchdown Alley, southeast of McLane Stadium.
summary: The seventh stop on the Tour has the Nissan Heisman House helping Baylor fans break in the new McLane Stadium. The Bears will be hunting for Cowboys, as they seek revenge against an Oklahoma State team that in 2013 dominated the then number four ranked Bears and almost cost them a Big 12 Championship and BCS Bowl berth. Bryce Petty will also be looking to build on a great resume that saw him finish seventh in last year’s Heisman voting. Fans can have to opportunity to win prizes, get autographs from past players, and break down game footage with our host before the Bears take on the Cowboys.
title: Oklahoma State @ Baylor

venue.name: McLane Stadium
venue.street1: South Martin Luther King Junior Boulevard

pageDescription: In what has traditionally been a vicious intrastate rivalry, a down trodden Gators squad was picked apart at home in 2013 by the Seminoles and future Heisman Trophy winner, Jamies Winston.   While Florida will be seeking revenge and the “Governor’s Cup,” Florida State and Winston will have their eyes on one of the four College Football Playoff semifinal spots. Whether a Gator or a ‘Nole, fans will have a chance to talk football with ESPNs Neil Everett, rub elbows with past Heisman winners, and win prizes from various interactive games during the last regular season stop for the Nissan Heisman House.
pageKeywords: Nissan Heisman House Tour, Tallahassee , FL, ESPN College GameDay, Neil Everett, Florida Football, Florida State Football
recap: When it comes to rivalry week in college football, you can throw out a team’s record or past matchups. Some teams are playing for a shot at a national championship or better bowl position and others simply for state pride. Regardless of their motives, you can always bet that both teams will come to play. The story was no different in Tallahassee this weekend, the Florida Gators were playing for recently fired head coach, Will Muschamp and the chance to end the perfect season of in-state rival, Florida State Seminoles. Before the action happened on the field, the Nissan Heisman House brought the pregame action to the fans. 1993 Heisman Trophy winner, Charlie Ward, and 2008 Rhode Scholar recipient and former FSU safety, Myron Rolle, got fans amped up with chalk talks hosted by ESPN personality, Neil Everett. Both players shared their unique stories of time spent at FSU, and memories of playing against the Gators. Fans were also able to celebrate past Florida State Heisman Trophy winners, by posing for photos with the coveted hardware and sharing with friends, or taking a ride in the Nissan Rogue with their favorite past winner. It was nothing but love inside the Heisman House, however once on the field it was business as usual for the Seminoles, as 2013 Heisman Trophy winner, Jameis Winston led his team to victory and kept their College Football Playoff hopes alive. The regular season has come to a close for the Nissan Heisman House, but the fun hasn’t ended. The House will help ring in the New Year in New Orleans for the first ever College Football Playoff Semifinal.
site: The Heisman House will be included in the Seminole Village fan fest, outside of Doak Campbell Stadium.
summary: In what has traditionally been a vicious intrastate rivalry, a down trodden Gators squad was picked apart at home in 2013 by the Seminoles and future Heisman Trophy winner, Jameis Winston. While Florida will be seeking revenge and the Governor's Cup, Florida State and Winston will have their eyes on one of the four College Football Playoff semifinal spots. Whether a Gator or a ‘Nole, fans will have a chance to talk football with ESPNs Neil Everett, rub elbows with past Heisman winners, and win prizes from various interactive games during the last regular season stop for the Nissan Heisman House.
title: Florida @ Florida State

pageDescription: The Nissan Heisman House will be in “The Big Easy” for a New Year’s Day celebration that ushers in the beginning of a new era in college football with the first ever College Football Playoff. The winner of this matchup will move on for the chance to be crowned the first ever College Football Playoff National Champion. Fans can celebrate in style at the Heisman House where they can meet legends from both teams, get their photo with the Heisman trophy, and compete to win prizes!
pageKeywords: Nissan Heisman House Tour, New Orleans, LA, ESPN College GameDay, Neil Everett, Sugar Bowl
recap: The New Year’s tradition of making resolutions and promises only to quickly forget them is as old as time itself. However, there is one New Year’s promise that won’t be left in the dust anytime soon. It is the excitement brought to college football fans by ESPN with the “New Year’s Six” slate of games. The best of these match-ups was brought to you primetime in the bayou between the Alabama Crimson Tide and The Ohio State Buckeyes. The Nissan Heisman House loves a celebration and brought the entertainment and excitement to Champions Square. Fans of both teams were able to meet Heisman winners, Troy Smith and Mark Ingram. Both players are familiar with participating in championship games and were able to give hot takes on the match-up and shared their experiences playing in a game of this magnitude. As if fans weren't amped enough, they were able to take photos with their favorite Heisman winner in the all-new Nissan Murano, and get up-close and personal with the prestigious trophy. After getting decked out in foam helmets and t-shirts from their favorite teams, fans made their way into the game. With chants of “Roll Tide,” and “O-H,” filling the dome, toe met leather and the game was on. In what turned out to be a monumental battle from beginning to the bitter end, the underdog Buckeyes upset the Alabama powerhouse and stamped their ticket to Dallas. The Nissan Heisman House has also booked a ticket to the first-ever College Football Playoff Championship, and will be bringing fans all of the action from the Championship Tailgate, right outside of AT&T Stadium.
site: The Heisman House will be included in the Allstate Sugar Bowl Fan Jam, in Champions Square.
summary: The Nissan Heisman House will be in “The Big Easy” for a New Year's Day celebration that ushers in the beginning of a new era in college football with the first ever College Football Playoff. The winner of this matchup will move on for the chance to be crowned the first ever College Football Playoff National Champion. Fans can celebrate in style at the Heisman House where they can meet legends from both teams, get their photo with the Heisman trophy, and compete to win prizes!
title: Sugar Bowl

pageDescription: All roads lead to this game and the Nissan Heisman House has been paving the way all season. The top two teams in college football meet in North Texas to battle it out and prove they are worthy to take home the first ever College Football Playoff Trophy. It’s also the last chance this season for fans to meet past Heisman winners and participate in interactive games for the chance to win prizes. Don’t miss out!
pageKeywords: Nissan Heisman House Tour, Arlington, TX, ESPN College GameDay, Neil Everett, College Football Playoff National Championship
recap: History has been made this year and fans finally received what they have been begging for each season, a proper College Football Playoff. No more arguing about who was left out, or what bias (or perceived bias) got a team into a Championship game, this year there was one undisputed champion. It has been a long road full of exceptional football moments and discouraging upsets, and the Nissan Heisman House has been there every step of the way to bring fans all the action. There was no better end to such a remarkable season than bringing college football’s most prestigious trophy to the fans at the premiere College Football Playoff Championship Tailgate. When it comes to championship games, you must have championship level talent. The Nissan Heisman House presented fans with opportunities to hear from former athletes from both schools. The quarterback position was represented by former Oregon player, Joey Harrington, and 2006 Heisman Trophy winner, Troy Smith. The running back spot was repped by 1982 Heisman Trophy winner, Herschel Walker. The Heisman House was packed from wall to wall with both Buckeye and Duck fans. When they weren't listening to chalk talks, host by ESPN personality, Neil Everett, they were busy saying, “Championship!” as they posed with the Heisman Trophy and checked out the Nissan Titan pickup. Fans were dressed to the nines in Heisman House helmets and t-shirts as they made their way into AT&T stadium for the pre-game festivities and to witness the historic kick-off. Fans of both teams created an explosive atmosphere as both teams took the field. In what was a surprise to many, the 2014 Heisman Trophy winner, Marcus Mariotta and a high powered Oregon offense was obliterated by the Buckeyes and the Ezekiel Elliott led offense, whose running met no match that night. With a Buckeyes victory, the 2014 college football season came to an end and so does the Nissan Heisman House, until next year of course. Look for the Nissan Heisman House in 2015 as it makes stops at a top college football matchup near you.  Thank you to all of the fans who participated and helped make this season great!
site: The Nissan Heisman House will be located inside the Championship Tailgate outside of AT&T Stadium.
summary: All roads lead to this game and the Nissan Heisman House has been paving the way all season. The top two teams in college football meet in North Texas to battle it out and prove they are worthy to take home the first ever College Football Playoff Trophy. It’s also the last chance this season for fans to meet past Heisman winners and participate in interactive games for the chance to win prizes. Don’t miss out!
title: College Football Playoff National Championship
